declarations.name: createRouter
declarations.description: Creates and configures the application's Tanstack Router instance for client-side routing. Used to provide routing context to the React application.
declarations.implementationNotes: This function is imported from './router' and is used to instantiate the router for the client application. It is passed to <StartClient> for hydration.

declarations.name: hydrateRoot
declarations.description: Hydrates a server-rendered React application on the client, attaching event listeners and enabling interactivity.

container.description: The DOM element to hydrate into.

initialChildren.description: The React element tree to hydrate.

declarations.signature: function hydrateRoot(container: any, initialChildren: any): void
declarations.implementationNotes: Called with the document and the <StartClient router={router} /> element to hydrate the React app on the client.

definition.name: StartClient
definition.purpose: Bootstraps and hydrates a Tanstack Router-based React application on the client.
definition.description: A React component that initializes the client-side application using Tanstack Router, enabling routing and navigation after hydration.

router.description: The Tanstack Router instance to use for routing.

initial.data: The application is hydrated and routing is enabled.

visible: The root of the React application

when.description: The application is loaded and hydrated on the client.

effects: Event listeners are attached and routing is enabled

definition.visualLayout: Wraps the root of the React application, providing routing context.
definition.implementationNotes: Imported from '@tanstack/react-start', this component is used as the root for client-side hydration with Tanstack Router.
